page.title: 12The Methodist Chapel, Sutton
page.content: In 1821 Methodism came to Sutton on Trent. In 1878 the present Methodist Chapel was established in the village. The present minister is the Rev. G. Middlemist.He lives in Southwell.On average only 16 people attend each week. There are 10 children in the Sunday School. There are no clubs or societies attached to the chapel,but some social functions take place there. In 1960 a new Methodist hall was built with interesting stained glass depicting the village mill. The hall is currently used for chapel events,clinic and play group.It may also be hired for private functions.
